page.title: 02Rogiet
page.content: One mile West of{Caldicot}on the B4245 is the Village of{Rogiet.}Early in the nineteenth century it was just a small agricultural hamlet with a population of 35. There are now about 1,400 inhabitants. During the latter half of the 19th century the railway came with the opening of the{Severn Tunnel}in 1886. A large marshalling yard developed at the junction just south of Rogiet. Many local men are still employed by British Rail. Footpaths run from the village out into the country and down to the Caldicot Levels. There are playing fields and allotments and the Severn Wildfowlers shoot over the land and shore of the{Severn Estuary.
